Tweak comment scroll tracker behaviour
Improve revision slider behaviour

fields.description:
No notifications are sent when DefaultReviewService is used to create a comment (hence doesn't make it into the activitystream).

This was observed by James Roper on 1.6.5 build 362.
fields.summary: No notifications sent for comments created through REST

fields.description:
When I browse changelists in FishEye I get clickable ID's for existing Crucible reviews against the changelists I am viewing. This is very helpful, but this does not occur if I browse changelists in the 'Manage Files' tab whilst creating a new review through Crucible.

It would be helpful if  you could add this.
fields.summary: Show existing Crucible reviews against changelists while selecting files for a new review.
fix rendering/script issue in IE
make the slider handles move in unison

fields.description:
see https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/PL-1220 for details

We should resolve this asap, as it totally breaks IntelliJ and Ecilpse Connector with Crucible 1.7 (AtlasEye) - i.e. currently Connector is not able to present any comments from Crucible 1.7.

Could you give us background details on why this part of remote API has changed?
fields.summary: Unexpected remote API changes around review comments

fields.description:
When attempting to expand some files on the review tab crucible is reporting the following:

      There was an error in the response from the server.
      Refresh the page before posting more comments.
      Click 'show details' for more information.

      The reported problem was:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

      You are running release CR1.6.6 FE1.6.6 (build-376 2009-02-12), please report your release number when reporting bugs.

Error log is attached.

This problem was observed in Crucible 1.6.4, upgraded in hope of fixing, no imporvement in Crucible 1.6.6.
fields.summary: Crucible is reporting server errors when attempting to expand files on the review tab.

fields.description: As seen in the attached screen dump in some cases Crucible is failing to expand files on the review tab (it reports "nothing to display") or hanging forever when attempting to expand a file (displays animated progress fan and gets no further).
fields.summary: Crucible is failing to expand files or hanging when attempting to expand files.

fields.description: I have to decrease the fonts (Ctrl + -) in the browser to see "Join Review" button. See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Join review button is hidden in main review view
Mark comment read when it hits top of the viewport

fields.description:
http://img.skitch.com/20090220-1jmikft5nr4n9dtufb481t3y2c.jpg

when the comment is made on the viewed to and from revision, where the from line is decided by the tetris model to be equivalent to some line on the to revision, it shows the comment at that line, when it shouldnt. 

in the linked image, the comment is made on from-31 and to-37, though from-31 is seen by the tetris model as being related to to-38
fields.summary: the tetris model gutterline is wrong in certain cases

fields.description:
for some reason the source says that neither of them come before the other (even though the "trunk" revision was found through firstDiffAncestor())

since they are considered totally unrelated, the revisions get added to the review in the order they are added, so the branch one first, then the trunk on after it (ie. the wrong order).
fields.summary: adding to review doesnt work properly when you add the first file after a branch

fields.description:
For details please see this post...

http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257299908

A tool to validty check the system would be very useful indeed.
fields.summary: FishEye/Crucible integrity checking tool

fields.description:
The Maven SCM api supports quite a few SCMs: http://maven.apache.org/scm/scms-overview.html

It would be great to implement the Cru SCM plugin API with Maven SCM as the backing 'SCM'. We'd get all these repos for free if so.

Admittedly the Maven SCM API is more geared towards CI - checking out and building - than Crucible's needs of historical data fetching. A quick inspection revealed some missing pieces, like revision content streaming. But it is still worth some investigation because the pay off would be high if we could work around those issues.
fields.summary: Crucible SCM plugin that uses the Maven SCM API
update 'above' versions of inline comments and replies.

fields.description: Currently, we can only select built in or ldap user to the permission schemes. It would be great if we can add LDAP group to the permission schemes.
fields.summary: Ability to add LDAP groups within permissions schemes

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce 

1) In Administration > Permission Schemes, create a copy of the default permission scheme, called it "New" 
2) In Administration > Projects, edit each project and move the permission scheme to "New" from default 
3) Go to Administration > Permission Schemes and delete the default 
4) Create a copy of the "New" can call it default 
5) Shutdown and restart the server. 

You will get the following:

ERROR - failed batch

{noformat}
2009-02-11 11:41:50,906 ERROR [main] fisheye.app HibernateUtil-commitTransaction - Commit failed rolling back.

Checking the {{FISHEYE_INST/var/data/crudb/crucible.script}} file you see 

{noformat}
INSERT INTO PERM_SCHEME VALUES(2,'new')
INSERT INTO PERM_SCHEME VALUES(3,'default')
{noformat}

i.e. no permission scheme of 1 and a permission schem that has name=default
fields.summary: Deleting the default permission scheme while having another scheme called default will cause the Crucible to not start up

fields.description:
In jira you need to map jira projects to crucible projects, which AFAIK is only used when creating a review from jira. It is however necessary otherwise the user is presented with an unwieldy list.

We have 400 jira projects, the intention is that they all use crucible at some point. So setting them up at /secure/admin/AssociateCruProjects.jspa is a pain. No doubt I could use the API to write something but why should I? ;-)

You cannot use the same key as that screws up the links. So we follow the recommended convention for cru keys which is the jira key prepended with CR-.

Can we have another radio button that says "follow recommended convention"? then I can do away with worrying about this page. You could even provide facility for a reg exp or something (although overkill in my opinion).

cheers, jamie
fields.summary: Associating crucible projects to jira projects is a PITA++, particularly as we follow the recommended convention

fields.description: As part of the new backup/restore mechanism, the TCP-based remote command code has been modified to use socket.shutdownOutput() when sending a command to the server (backup/restores relies on the connection to be closed). However, half closed TCP connections seem to be [problematic on OSX and Windows|http://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=697238282] causing problems for long-running commmands.
fields.summary: Remove the use of half closed TCP connections

fields.description: Also see: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/browse/FE/trunk/src/tests-cru/com/atlassian/crucible/spi/rpc/RestReviewServiceTest.java?r=27859#l696
fields.summary: Change SPI to support multiple revisions per FRX

fields.description: see http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/FECRU/MySQL+Index+Solutions
fields.summary: find solution for mysql unique index length restriction

fields.description:
Happened (reproducible every time) when we had on AtlasEye (no longer) Connector projects configured in Crucible by Tim to use SVN plugin instead of FishEye.
We had 2 repos (both provided by SVN  plugin) used in single Crucible project.
I was unable to create any review. Crucible was not able to fetch the content of any file.
See attached screenshot.

It seems that paths to SVN were screwed up (e.g. ACC/ACC instead of just ACC).
fields.summary: Strange problems while trying to use SCM plugin for SVN with multiple repositories

fields.description: For LDAP integration, Fisheye should be able to have an option to retrieve user's lastname and firstname as "Display Name" when creating account automatically in FishEye.
fields.summary: Option for account display name

fields.description: Currently, when selecting a reviewer during review creation, it only shows the user id. It would be good to show user's lastname and firstname.
fields.summary: Show user's lastname and firstname when selecting a reviewer

fields.description:
One of the developers on our team is red-green colour-blind so the default colour scheme for diffs in Crucible is not very helpful for him. 

The classis (muted) colour scheme is even worse. Can you provide a few additional colour schemes, or allow users to create their own?


h3. Workaround

Use the ['Look and Feel' app|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1216128/look-and-feel-for-fisheye-and-crucible?hosting=server&tab=overview] to customise colours.
fields.summary: Crucible colour schemes for colour-blindness

fields.description:
Users wish to be able to print reviews. The best option I can give them at the moment is to use the Email Review functionality, then print the resulting email.

bq. I was wondering if you knew of any way to get a nice printable version of the crucible review, with all the diffs and comments clearly visible?
fields.summary: printable reviews!

fields.description:
Currently Crucible Projects are listed in the Global Settings area.

Should move Projects to it's own area similar to how Repository List is.   This will move it from the "little changed" global settings and more into the "regular changing" area.

This will improve daily administration tasks for large Crucible servers with many many crucible projects.
fields.summary: Crucible Project should move from Global Settings to own Section
just do it

fields.description: mainly just an indicator.  This is a review level red dot.  We are not supporting polling for the red dot

render list of reviews

Catch all external create review links (e.g. from fisheye and jira) and warn me if there are related reviews before creating a new jira So I don't create new reviews unless I really want to.
render author + participant results
render machine results
update review modal dialog + button to get there

fields.description: grouped by match type

find open reviews for given changeset (commit log has review ID)

fields.description: i.e. look for open review ids in commit message, or reviews that contain files currently under review http://dl-client.getdropbox.com/u/46525/iterativereview/mockup_ir-addtoexisting.png.   From a machine perspective "high confidence" = review id in commit and file in review.  Possibly committer is author.
fields.summary: mechanism to find related reviews for a given commit or string (jira id passed by plugin) and the reverse, find potentially related commits from a review.
find and fix all other comment counts
fix what matt broke

fields.description: 1.6.x and earlier didn't consider replies as comments, given we want to count replies in unread counts we should be consistent for all counts.
fields.summary: Count replies in all comment counts
call existing add action get result reload existing FRX
add dropdown for red dot

fields.description:
i.e. click the red dot and select from menu with two items, first item existing "view diff to latest" second option "add latest revision to review". Choosing the later option will add the latest revision (and only the latest) and reload the FRX.

see http://dl-client.getdropbox.com/u/46525/iterativereview/mockup_ir-slider.png
fields.summary: Add latest revision to review on a per file basis
add comment counts per revision
add gutter indicators for comments you add
use line pair mechanism for displaying annotations
add tetris columns to frx jsps
match lines to revisions using diff data

fields.description: it breaks some db constraint
fields.summary: cant delete an frx with inline comments

fields.description:
REST and API changes due to multi-revisions-per-frx:

The java API/POJOs need a way to expose and manipulate multiple revisions per frx.

As do the REST apis.

We also need to introduce the new distinction between FRXComment and InlineComment in the API and REST interface.
fields.summary: api changes for multi-revisions and revision comments

fields.description: This is a request to add SCM support for MKS (http://www.mks.com) to the default Crucible installation.
fields.summary: Support MKS in Crucible

fields.description:
This is a request for an improvement to the review summary email.  We would like it to include:

* Summary of the files/versions in the review
* Summary of comments by severity/type
fields.summary: Expand Review Summary Email

fields.description: The CrucibleHostContextAccessor extends the SAL SpringHostContextAccessor.  This uses the Spring transaction manager (configured to use the Hibernate transaction manager) to setup a transaction.  The problem with this, is that Crucible, as far as I can see, doesn't use a transaction manager, or rather, it uses its own transaction manager, TxHelper, which interacts directly with hibernate.  So the transactions started by CrucibleHostContextAccessor are never committed.  Unless Crucible starts using the spring transaction manager, CrucibleHostContextAccessor needs to be rewritten to use TxHelper.
fields.summary: CrucibleHostContextAccessor does not commit transactions
Crucible integration with Microsoft Visual Studio

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1) Ensure that SMTP server is set and public signup is on 
2) Create a review
3) In the "invite reviewers" press invite with a blank text field
4) In the "invite reviewers" press invite with "test" in the text field. 

Both of these appear to be added with no error message, despite the fact that both are not valid email addresses. 

Also, add a check for an empty/undefined email address and also make the error reporting clear as to what the error is either on screen or in the logs.
fields.summary: Need to add validation on "invite reviewers" to prevent erronous input

fields.description:
Use case: I use the monit daemon on my server to make sure the production services stay running; this requires having a PID file for each service; monit then knows what the process ID is and can check whether it's up, and take appropriate action.

The attached version of fisheyectl.sh places the pid file at the location specified by the FISHEYE_PID environment variable (default FISHEYE_INST/var/fisheye.pid).  It also uses the pidfile to check for a running instance of Crucible, and prevents the service from being started twice.

I'm putting my modifications in the public domain so that this can be added to the shipped fisheyectl.sh.  Can you review and include in a future release if appropriate?  Credit would be appreciated but is not required.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Add support for PID file

fields.description: The admin page still invokes the old backup code. Must be changed to the new. This fix does not include rendering a progress bar.
fields.summary: Change the admin backup page to use the new backup/restore implementation

fields.description:
1) Copy attached config.xml into your FISHEYE_INST
2) Start your crucible 1.6.5.a
3) You will see the following info:
{noformat}
Could not find a Crucible license.
 Please visit http://my.atlassian.com and quote AVHY-MAV6-ZYSB-0Z6S to obtain a valid license,
     or visit http://www.atlassian.com/fisheye/renew to renew your license.
{noformat}
4) When you go to your instance, e.g. [http://localhost:8060/] it redirects you to [http://localhost:8060/setup]
5) You see the screenshot attached. No place to enter cru license
6) If you enter admin to confirm the admin password, you still see no place to enter the license. 

In order to workaround the issue is to remove your fisheye license from your config.xml (delete the <fisheye>%FISHEYE_LICENSE%</fisheye> bit, including the fisheye tag itself) and restart the server. It will ask you to fill in both licenses.
fields.summary: When upgrading from fisheye to crucible, the UI does not allow you to enter the Crucible license

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce 

1) Ensure there is a user that has a null email address. (You cannot create user with null email address via built in fisheye authentication, as it will default to "", thus you need to hook up to external user auth such as LDAP that contains user with no email address). 
2) Create review 
3) Go to "Email Review" and add a null email address user to the Recipients
4) Send the email, you will get the following:

fields.description:
The page on flagging defects at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/2.3.2+Flagging+Defects doesn't mention how users can follow up on defects. It should point people to use JIRA and raise issues there. 

I know that there are plans for new integration but am logging this anyway as it's a relatively simple fix.
fields.summary: Document how to follow up on defects flagged in Crucible reviews by raising them in JIRA

fields.description: Restoring a database to a remote database (as opposed to the in-process, in-memory hsqldb) is relatively slow. Batched inserts should speed this up.

call mark-as-read as needed
